xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels

Class Kernels

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels.Kernels

  • public class Kernels
extends Object
    This class provides some static methods for computing respectively processing kernel estimators and the corresponding bandwidths, e.g., estimating the roughness of function.
    See Also:
    AbstractKernelDensityEstimator, AbstractKernelCDF, KernelFunction

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double kernelDerivativeEstimator(double x, Object[] sample, int degree, double g)
      Computes an estimation of the r-th derivative of f at x using the r-th derivative or the Gaussian kernel, a given bandwidth g and a random sample.
      static double normalDerivativeAt0(int r)
      Returns the r-th derivative of the Gaussian kernel evaluated at 0.
      static double normalDerivatives(int r, double x)
      Computes the r-th derivative of the Gaussian function at x.
      static double roughnessEstimator(double g, Object[] sample, int r)
      Returns an estimation of the roughness of a function f using a kernel estimator.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • roughnessEstimator

        public static double roughnessEstimator(double g,
                                        Object[] sample,
                                        int r)
        Returns an estimation of the roughness of a function f using a kernel estimator. The roughness R_r(f) of degree r is defined by R_r(f) = \int f^r(x) dx.
        Parameters:
        g - used bandwidth
        sample - used sample to compute the estimation. Given as Objects of type Number.
        r - degree of the derivative
        Returns:
        an estimation of the roughness of a function f

      • normalDerivativeAt0

        public static double normalDerivativeAt0(int r)
        Returns the r-th derivative of the Gaussian kernel evaluated at 0.
        Parameters:
        r - degree of the derivative
        Returns:
        value of the r-th derivative of the Gaussian kernel at 0

      • normalDerivatives

        public static double normalDerivatives(int r,
                                       double x)
        Computes the r-th derivative of the Gaussian function at x.
        Parameters:
        r - degree of the derivative
        x - function argument
        Returns:
        value of the r-th derivative of the pdf of the N(0,1) distribution at x

      • kernelDerivativeEstimator

        public static double kernelDerivativeEstimator(double x,
                                               Object[] sample,
                                               int degree,
                                               double g)
        Computes an estimation of the r-th derivative of f at x using the r-th derivative or the Gaussian kernel, a given bandwidth g and a random sample.
        Parameters:
        x - where to evaluate the estimation
        sample - used sample to compute the estimation. Given as Objects of type Number.
        degree - degree of the derivative
        g - used bandwidth
        Returns:
        an estimation f^(r)_g (x) of f^(r)(x)
